covid-info.title: Test Bookings - FAQ
covid-info.footer:
Do you have further questions?
Write in to us at support@biomarking.com!

item1.question: 1. What is a COVID 19 PCR test and what is it for?
item1.body:
PCR stands for ‘polymerase chain reaction’. It is a method that is used to detect and accurately identify genetic material from any organism. The COVID-19 PCR test is currently the preferred test for COVID-19 detection because of its speed, accuracy and success rate- hence is widely used as the testing method of choice for pre-departure travel, work and social responsibility purposes. It is considered the gold-standard (best-in-class) for detection of COVID-19.

Most COVID-19 PCR test results will be ready within a few hours. However we recommend that you ask the staff at your selected test center/clinic for a more precise time frame.

item2.question: 2. What is Antigen testing?
item2.body: An antigen test detects coronavirus proteins in the mouth and throat. It works by mixing the sample with a solution that unleashes specific viral proteins. However, it takes a shorter time to generate a result as compared to a PCR test. Antigen tests typically take 15-30mins to generate a result and are generally deemed to be less accurate than PCR tests.

item3.question: 3. What is Serology testing?
item3.body: Serology is also called the Antibody test that looks for the presence of antibodies. Antibodies are typically detected in the blood of people who are tested after infection and they show an immune response to the infection. It is important for detecting previous infections in people who had few or no symptoms.

item4.question: 4. What are the types of COVID-19 tests available?
item4.body: A comprehensive range of COVID-19 tests are offered on our platform, including COVID-19 PCR, antigen, and serology tests. However, different clinics may have different tests available, and you will be able to see what each clinic offers during the booking process.

item5.question: 5. How will the COVID-19 PCR test be performed?
item5.body: The test will be performed at the desired clinic by a healthcare professional (Doctor/Nurse). The COVID-19 PCR test is conducted by using a swab to collect respiratory samples found in your nose and your throat. A swab is a soft tip on a long flexible stick that goes into your nose. The sample is collected then sealed and sent to the laboratory for testing.

item6.question: 6. Where can I get tested?
item6.body: BioMark's partner test centers and clinics are listed in the app/website and displayed in a map for your convenience.

item7.question: 7. Is BioMark a MOH-approved COVID-19 test provider?
item7.body: BioMark is only the facilitator to connect patients to healthcare providers to get tested for COVID-19. The healthcare providers providing the COVID-19 swab tests would be MOH-approved according to the guidelines of their respective country.

item8.question: 8. Who is eligible for the COVID-19 tests? Am I eligible?
item8.body: Suspected cases, quarantined, and under investigation are eligible to book a COVID-19 Test. For those with signs and symptoms prior to your clinic visit, kindly indicate it in your health declaration. A COVID-19 test can be used for anyone regardless of age. COVID-19 tests are not limited to travellers, but it can also be for people who would like to find out if they have COVID-19.

item9.question: 9. I need to get a COVID-19 PCR test urgently, are there any expedited options?
item9.body:
Participating clinics that can do urgent swab tests will be indicated in the app/website during booking for your convenience. You may also select the express PCR test to receive your results within about 6 hours.

For travellers taking COVID-19 PCR tests for pre-departure purposes, please note that you are responsible for checking that your appointment and testing window is in line with the destination country’s regulations. We will not be liable for rejection of test results due to failed compliance of guidelines provided by the airline or authorities.

item10.question: 10. Can I do a home-testing instead of going to the test center?
item10.body: Yes. We have home testing available. Simply select ‘Home Test’ when you are making a booking and provide the relevant information as requested. We will be in contact with you after you have made your booking to organize appropriately.

item11.question: 11. How much are the COVID-19 tests?
item11.body: Test centers and clinics may choose to price their tests differently. When you make a booking on the app, the price should be displayed for you as you choose your tests.

item12.question: 12. Are there any subsidies/claims available for the COVID-19 tests?
item12.body:
We apologise that BioMark, with the test centers, clinics and laboratories that provide the COVID-19 tests through the BioMark platforms currently do not have any arrangements for subsidies.

However, we do provide a receipt upon completion and confirmation of successful payment which may be requested by your company/insurer for this purpose. Please verify any ability for subsidies or claims with your company/insurer beforehand.

item13.question: 13. Why do I need to verify my identity?
item13.body: Identity verification is a faster alternative compared to in-person identity verification and removes your need to wait at patient registration counters.

item14.question: 14. Who are considered Dependants and how can I make a booking for them?
item14.body: You will be able to make bookings for yourself and others (eg. spouse, child, siblings, parents, grandparents, guardian, or others) via the app. Click on “Add New Dependant” and fill in the Dependant’s details to book an appointment for them.

item15.question: 15. Can I book a COVID-19 test for other countries?
item15.body: We currently support COVID-19 bookings in Singapore and Malaysia. You will be able to book a COVID-19 test in Singapore from Malaysia, and vice versa.

item16.question: 16. How will I know if my booking was made successfully?
item16.body:
You will receive a confirmation email with your appointment details and/or receipt upon payment verification by your financial services provider.

You can also refer to your booking details under the COVID-19 Bookings section in our BioMark patient app.

item17.question: 17. What happens if I did not receive any confirmation email?
item17.body: If the confirmation email does not show up in the inbox, kindly check your spam folder or contact us at support@biomarking.com with your name and booking details so that we can resend the information to you.

item18.question: 18. What should I do to prepare for my COVID-19 test?
item18.body:
A notification will be sent out for you to complete a health declaration form within 24 hours from your test date. Please fill up the form with information that is as accurate as possible.

For travellers taking COVID-19 PCR tests for pre-departure purposes, please note that you are responsible for checking that your appointment and testing window is in line with the destination country’s regulations. We will not be liable for rejection of test results due to failed compliance of guidelines provided by the airline or authorities.

item19.question: 19. What documents do I need to bring for my appointment?
item19.body: Please bring your identity card and also have a copy of your appointment confirmation on hand. It is important that the copy of your appointment confirmation should display the confirmation number in the event that verification is required.

item20.question: 20. What are the supported methods of payment?
item20.body: Only e-payment is available currently via VISA, Mastercard. We are working to provide more payment options in the near future for your convenience.

item21.question: 21. What payment provider is BioMark using and can it be trusted?
item21.body: We engage trusted payment gateways to facilitate the payments for us. For Singapore, we are using Stripe as our payment partner and Billplz for Malaysia payments. Our payment partners process billions of dollars in payments annually and has best-in-class, bank grade security.

item22.question: 22. What should I do if I miss my appointment?
item22.body: Kindly contact us at support@biomarking.com if you need to reschedule your appointment.

item23.question: 23. Can I walk into any BioMark participating PCR swab clinic for a test without making an appointment?
item23.body: It is up to each clinic’s discretion whether they accept walk-ins. BioMark will not be responsible for any miscommunication if the patient chooses to walk in instead of making a booking via the website/app. It is highly recommended to make a booking before heading down to the clinic.

item24.question: 24. How do I retrieve my COVID-19 PCR test results and how long will it take?
item24.body:
Your COVID-19 PCR test results will be available in our BioMark App usually within 24-48 hours after the swab. The healthcare provider which you engaged to conduct the swab will also contact you in the event that your COVID-19 PCR test results return positive.

You will also be notified via email and receive a push notification from the app when your results are ready to view.

item25.question: 25. Will I get a PDF result?
item25.body: You will receive a PDF result attached to your email notification or via the app once your results are ready to view.

item26.question: 26. Can I use the resulting QR code at the airport?
item26.body:
We are using an encrypted QR code standard which is used to secure and verify your test result. The QR code is a secure certificate of your COVID-19 result.

When travelling abroad, the QR code can be shown to foreign travel authorities, who may scan the QR code with any reader (e.g. normal phone camera) to verify the authenticity of the digitally authenticated and endorsed QR code.

item27.question: 27. What happens if my COVID-19 PCR test result is inconclusive?
item27.body:
There might be instances that COVID-19 PCR swab test results are inconclusive. If your COVID-19 PCR test result is inconclusive, you might have to undergo a repeat test and it is chargeable. BioMark will not be held responsible for any losses, expenses, or costs involved, should this result affect your flight departure.

The healthcare provider which you engaged to conduct the test will contact you if a repeat test is necessary.

item28.question: 28. What happens if my COVID-19 PCR test result is positive?
item28.body:
If your COVID-19 PCR test results are positive, you should isolate yourself from family members, monitor your temperature and symptoms and also notify your close contact of your COVID-19 positive status. Please also refer to your country’s guidelines on home quarantine and isolation for COVID-19.

If you are taking a PCR test for the purpose of pre-departure travel, kindly inform the relevant authorities that you would be unfit to fly.

item29.question: 29. How do I change/cancel my booking?
item29.body: For cancellation or rescheduling of appointments, kindly email to support@biomarking.com with your reason for changing the appointment.

item30.question: 30. Will I get a refund if I were to cancel my booking?
item30.body:
Bookings that are cancelled 24 hours before the appointment timing will not be entitled to any refunds. You will also not be allowed to cancel your booking after you have been swabbed.

Appointment cancellation is also not allowed if the booking is made within 24 hours of the selected appointment time.

Do note that refunds are subjected to payment processing fees

item31.question: 31. Are clinics allowed to cancel/make changes to my appointment?
item31.body: Clinics are not allowed to cancel the appointment but may propose to reschedule the appointment, subject to your consent. Clinics have also been advised to reschedule only if it falls within the travel time and will not lead to any negative repercussions on flight departure.

item32.question: 32. When will I get my refunds?
item32.body: If your cancellation is entitled to a refund,  the refund will show up on the bank account you used to pay for the transaction within 5-10 business days (depending on the bank’s processing time).

item33.question: 33. Why is the refund not showing up on my bank statement after 10 business days?
item33.body:
If the cancellation is processed not long after the payment was made, the refund may be processed as a reversal. In which case, the original charge will drop off the bank statement altogether, as if it never occurred.

Check your bank statement and look for the original charge. If you do not see the charge on your bank statement, the payment was reversed and the refund is complete.

item34.question: 34. What is the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)?
item34.body:
According to the World Health Organization (WHO), Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

COVID-19 symptoms can include common cold symptoms, shortness of breath and in some cases, severe lung infection. Most people develop mild symptoms that can be treated with medication recommended by a doctor based on the patient’s clinical condition. However, severe cases may require hospital care where a patient may receive a combination of treatments.

item35.question: 35. How many variants of the coronavirus are there?
item35.body: Variants of a virus occurs when there is a change (mutation) to the virus’s genes. Mutation of viruses are neither new nor unexpected. As of now, many variants have emerged in different parts of the world, but the variants of concern for SARS-CoV-2 as listed by the WHO include the Delta variant and the Omicron variant.

item36.question: 36. What is the Delta variant?
item36.body: The Delta variant was first identified in late 2020s in India and identified to be more than twice as contagious as the previous variants. Some data also suggests that the Delta variant  has a higher probability of causing severe illness in unvaccinated people, as compared to the previous variants. However, if infected, the amount of viral genetic material may go down faster in fully vaccinated people when compared to unvaccinated people.

item37.question: 37. What is the Omicron variant and can it be detected?
item37.body: WHO describes the Omicron variant as a variant of concern based on the evidence of several mutations which affects the way it behaves. The variant was first detected in an outbreak at a University town in South Africa with a younger demographic. There is currently insufficient information about the variant in terms of how serious it is and its transmissibility. Studies are underway to understand more about this variant. But the presence of the Omicron variant can still be detected through COVID-19 tests, which is available for booking on the BioMark Platform. It is best to consult with a physician if you are concerned that you may have Covid.

bloodPressureTab.title: Tekanan Darah
bloodPressureTab.definition: Tekanan darah Anda mengukur tekanan darah yang mengalir dalam pembuluh darah Anda. Nilai teratas adalah penafsiran sistolik yang mengukur tekanan ketika jantung Anda berdetak. Angka di bawah adalah penafsiran diastolik Anda yang mengukur tekanan ketika jantung Anda beristirahat di antara denyutan jantung.

hba1cTab.title: HbA1c (%)
hba1cTab.definition: HbA1c (Haemoglobin A1C) adalah suatu tes yang menggambarkan kadar gula darah rata-rata selama 2 - 3 bulan terakhir.

bloodSugarTargetInput.fastingDefinition: FPG (Gula Darah Plasma Puasa) adalah ukuran kadar gula darah Anda setelah puasa atau tidak memiliki apa pun untuk dimakan selama paling tidak 8 jam. Tes ini biasanya dilakukan terlebih dahulu di pagi hari, sebelum sarapan.
bloodSugarTargetInput.afterMealDefinition: PPG (Gula Darah Postprandial) adalah ukuran kadar gula darah Anda setelah makan. Mengukur PPG dapat melacak lonjakan gula darah, yang dapat menentukan jika insulin waktu makan Anda bekerja.

withdraw.title: Are You Sure?
withdraw.description: Are you sure you want to withdraw from the Empower Program? You will lose access to all your Empower Program privileges.

titles.titleDiabetes: By signing this form, you hereby:

disclaimer.paragraph:
1. Agree to participate in the EMPOWER Patient Program for Insulin Glargine/Lixisenatide and Glargine U300 for which you were informed by your enrolling physician. I likewise agree to be enrolled in the said Program by my physician.

2. Acknowledge that you are aware that all data related to you will be accessible only to the third party provider of Sanofi-Aventis Philippines Inc. involved in the program and all data will be handled with full confidentiality in compliance with the Data Privacy Act and all related issuances.

3. Acknowledge that you have the right to access and correct your personal information at any time upon your request.

4. Acknowledge that you can withdraw from the EMPOWER Patient Program for Insulin Glargine/Lixisenatide and Glargine U300 at any time without any prejudice by contacting My Blood Profile Technologies Corporation, a subsidiary of BioMark Pte Ltd, and that already collected data will remain in the specific EMPOWER Patient Program database, unless you request also for these data to be deleted. You can withdraw from the EMPOWER Patient Program at any time by clicking the “Withdraw from Program” link on the Diabetes Support Center page.

5. Acknowledge that you are aware that this program may be discontinued at any given time and that you will be notified thirty (30) days prior the discontinuation date.

6. Declare that you have carefully read the EMPOWER Patient Program for Insulin Glargine/Lixisenatide and Gargine U300 guidelines/mechanics and warrant that you will abide with such guidelines/mechanics.
disclaimer.paragraphHypertension:
• You agree to participate in the EMPOWER Patient Program for Insulin Glargine/Lixisenatide (Soliqua) or Insulin Glargine U300 (Toujeo), and/or Irbesartan + Amlodipine (Aprovasc) (the “Program”). You confirm that you were informed of this Program, and agree to be enrolled therein, by your enrolling physician.

  • By enrolling in the Program, you expressly give consent to third parties, and/or third party providers that sanofi-aventis Philippines Inc. ("Sanofi") engages or contracts with (collectively, "Third Party/ies") that are involved in the Program to collect and process your personal information and to conduct the Program in accordance with the following purposes (“Purposes”):

    1. Provide you education on diabetes and/or hypertension management, product handling, titration etc., as may be applicable. Medical assessment and case processing in the event of adverse drug reaction or Pharmacovigilance events.

    2. Give you proper device training in terms of proper and correct usage of medical devices and/or the Insulin Glargine/Lixisenatide (Soliqua) or Insulin Glargine U300 (Toujeo) solostar pen.

    3. You may be provided with seven (7) pieces of Irbesartan/Amlodipine (Aprovasc) every three (3) months for a period of one (1) year. Sanofi reserves the right to suspend the provision of doses, depending on availability and other factors.

    4. Provide you with regular reminder on regular blood glucose monitoring, regular blood pressure monitoring, other necessary laboratory test your doctor will require.

    5. Provide your enrolling physician with regular report on your activities in the Program for proper information feedback and monitoring.

  • You acknowledge that you are aware that the Program is not a clinical study and all data related to you will be accessible only to Third Party/ies involved in the Program, and all data will be handled with full confidentiality in compliance with the Data Privacy Act and all related issuances. Such data will be stored for a period of 10 years.

  • You acknowledge that data collected by our Nurse Educator in the format of medical record/s (“Medical Record”) will be collected in a patient relationship management system (“PRM”) operated by My Blood Profile Technology Corp. (“BioMark”) or any other Third Party/ies retained by Sanofi for the purpose, accessible only by Nurse Educators (from Home Health Care Placements, Inc. (“HHCP”)), BioMark and Third Party/ies. For the avoidance of doubt, Sanofi shall have no access to individual patient records.

  • You agree that your Medical Record will be shared by BioMark and Nurse Educators (from HHCP) to your enrolling physician.

  • You acknowledge that aggregated reports from the Program will be generated and accessible to Sanofi and Third Party/ies for purposes of assessing the Program's effectiveness to support in diabetes and/or hypertension management, and in evaluating the Program's potential for further improvements. You likewise agree that your personal data will be provided to Third Party/ies for the purpose of anonymizing the same before any further processing will be done, which processing includes the generation of aggregated data. You acknowledge that aggregated data from the Program may be used for publication purposes by Sanofi or Third Party/ies, such as, but not limited to, scientific papers, other written reports, etc. Aggregated reports that are anonymized consist of data provided in this form and those collected in the Program’s digital platforms (such as the Biomark Application). You understand that the strictest level of confidentiality and security will be maintained at any stage of the processing of your personal data.

  • You acknowledge that you have the right to access and correct your personal information at any time upon your request by downloading and updating the BioMark Application or by contacting 0919-433-3392 (Smart).

  • You acknowledge that the planned education session with Nurse Educators is good for one (1) year. Beyond this one-year period, the patient can avail of the BioMark application and call center, as long as the EMPOWER program is still active.

  • You acknowledge that you can withdraw from the Program at any time without prejudice by sending your message through the Biomark App or by contacting 0919-433-3392 (Smart). You agree that personal data already collected from you will remain in the specific Program database for the retention period mentioned above, unless you request also for these data to be deleted.

  • You acknowledge that you are aware that this Program may be discontinued at any given time and that you will be notified thirty (30) days prior the discontinuation date.
disclaimer.checkboxLabel: I hereby confirm my understanding of the above policy and my consent to the collection, use and disclosure of my information in accordance to the terms of the policy.

heart.text:
Perhitungan risiko jantung ini divalidasi oleh Studi Framingham Jantung untuk orang-orang berusia antara 30 dan 74 tahun dan tanpa riwayat penyakit jantung sebelumnya. 

Perhitungan mempertimbangkan faktor-faktor berikut:
heart.references: Pengelolaan Dyslipidaemia 2017 (Edisi Ke-5) Panduan Praktis Klinis, Kementerian Kesehatan Malaysia
heart.footNotes: Skor risiko kesehatan Anda hanyalah sebuah perkiraan. Selain itu, risiko Anda berubah setiap waktu. Silakan diskusikan dengan dokter Anda untuk informasi lebih lanjut.

cards.age: Risiko Anda meningkat pada usia di atas 35 tahun.
cards.gender: Laki-laki memiliki risiko yang lebih tinggi daripada perempuan.
cards.HDLCholesterol: Risiko Anda meningkat dengan kolesterol HDL yang lebih rendah.
cards.totalCholesterol: Risiko Anda meningkat dengan total kolesterol yang lebih tinggi.
cards.systolicBloodPressure: Risiko Anda meningkat dengan pembacaan tekanan darah sistolik (atas) yang lebih tinggi.
cards.bloodPressureMedication: Jika Anda saat ini sedang mengambil pengobatan tekanan darah, artinya Anda telah didiagnosa menderita tekanan darah tinggi (hipertensi). Ini menempatkan Anda pada risiko yang lebih tinggi.
cards.smoking: Menjadi perokok meningkatakan risiko Anda secara signifikan.
cards.diabetes: Jika Anda telah didiagnosa menderita diabetes, Anda berada dalam risiko yang lebih tinggi.

diabetes.text:
Skor risiko diabetes ini berdasarkan Ujian Risiko Diabetes Tipe 2 oleh Asosiasi Diabetes Amerika untuk orang-orang yang tidak memiliki riwayat diabetes atau pradiabetes sebelumnya. 
Ini mempertimbangkan faktor-faktor berikut:
diabetes.footNotes: Skor risiko diabetes Anda hanyalah sebuah perkiraan. Selain itu, risiko Anda berubah setiap saat. Hanya tes darah yang dapat menentukan diagnosis. Silakan diskusikan dengan dokter Anda untuk informasi lebih lanjut.

cards.age: Risiko Anda meningkat pada usia di atas 40 tahun.
cards.gender: Laki-laki cenderung memiliki diabetes tipe 2 dibandingkan dengan perempuan.
cards.gestationalDiabetes: Perempuan yang memiliki diabetes gestasional berada dalam risiko lebih tinggi.
cards.familyHistoryOfDiabetes: Riwayat keluarga diabetes dapat meningkatkan risiko Anda.
cards.highBloodPressure: Memiliki tekanan darah tinggi meningkatkan risiko Anda.
cards.exercise: Tidak aktif secara fisik meningkatkan risiko Anda.
cards.height: Tinggi Anda digunakan untuk menghitung Indeks Masa Tubuh (IMT). IMT yang lebih tinggi meningkatkan risiko Anda.
cards.weight: Berat Anda digunakan untuk menghitung Indeks Masa Tubuh (IMT). IMT yang lebih tinggi meningkatkan risiko Anda.

bp.text:
Tekanan darah Anda mengukur tekanan darah yang mengalir dalam pembuluh darah Anda.

Angka di atas adalah pembacaan sistolik Anda yang mengukur tekanan ketika jantung berdetak.

Angka di bawah adalah pembacaan diastolik Anda yang mengukur tekanan ketika Anda mendengarnya dalam keadaan santai di antara detak jantung.

Hipertensi didefiniskan sebagai kenaikan tekanan darah (BP) systolic secara terus menerus 130 mmHg atau lebih besar dari dan/atau Tensi darah diastolik 90 mmHg atau lebih, yang diambil setidaknya dua kali dalam dua kesempatan terpisah.

Jika nilai sistolik dan diastolik Anda di dalam kategori yang berbeda, Kami mengambil yang lebih tinggi dari dua klasifikasi. Misalnya, jika sistolik adalah normal tapi diastolik naik, maka tensi darah Anda akan diklasifikasikan naik.

Berikut adalah klasifikasi yang berbeda-beda:
bp.references: Pengelolaan Hipertensi (Edisi Keempat) Petunjuk Praktis Klinis, Kementrian Kesehatan Malaysia

bmi.text:
Indeks Masa Tubuh (IMT) anda adalah sebuah metode untuk memperkirakan jumlah lemak tubuh berdasarkan tinggi dan berat Anda.

IMT dihitung dengan membagi berat (kg) Anda dengan angka kuadrad dari tinggi Anda (m<sup>2</sup>).

IMT kerap salah kategorikan binaragawan sebagai kegemukan karena kelimpahan berat otot mereka. Oleh karenanya ia tidak seharusnya digunakan untuk kelompok individu ini.

Berikut adalah klasifikasi yang berbeda-beda:
bmi.references:
1. Organisasi Kesehatan Dunia (Asosiasi Internasional Association Untuk Studi Obesitas)

2. Penanganan Diabetes Mellitus Tipe 2 (Edisi Ke-5) Panduan Praktis Klinis, Kementerian Kesehatan Malaysia

drinking.text:
Mengukur unit alkohol adalah cara bermanfaat untuk memeriksa jika asupan alkohol Anda di atas atau di bawah batas yang dianjurkan.

Kalkulasi ini menggunakan unit alkohol yang bergantung pada volume (ABV) % dan takaran minuman tersebut.

Status alkohol Anda hanyalah sebuah perkiraan karena sangatlah sulit untuk memastikan keandalan unit alkohol. Ini karena ada berbagai takaran minuman alkohol yang tersedia.

cards.pint: Satu gelas bir (ABV 3.6%) setara dengan 2 unit.
cards.wine: Satu gelas anggur (ABV 12%) setara dengan 2.1 unit.
cards.shot: Satu seloki kecil minuman berkadar alkohol (25ml, ABV 40%) setara dengan 1 unit.

smoking.text:
Bungkus-tahun adalah satu cara untuk mengukur intensitas merokok. Ini mempertimbangkan berapa banyak dan berapa lama Anda telah merokok.

Ini dihitung dengan membagi jumlah batang rokok yang dihisap dalam satu hari dengan 20 dan kemudian mengalikannya dengan jumlah tahun merokok.

stress.text: Skala Persepsi Stres adalah di antara alat yang paling banyak digunakan untuk mengukur persepsi stres. Kuesioner ini menggunakan kerangka PSS-4.

sleeping.text:
Kebersihan tidur yang baik dapat membantu Anda mendapatkan waktu tidur malam yang baik.

Sejumlah daftar periksa tidur mencakup menetapkan waktu tidur rutin kapan akan pergi tidur dan bangun di pagi hari, pada waktu yang sama setiap hari. Membatasi waktu layar sebelum tidur, dan menghindari stimulan (kafein, nikotin, alkohol) apabila pendekatan waktu tidur akan membantu Anda mempercepatkan awal waktu tidur. Cara lainnya, mempertahankan kamar tidur Anda gelap dan segar akan membantu Anda tidur sepanjang malam tanpa terjaga.

Persyaratan tidur ini direkomendasikan oleh Yayasan Tidur Nasional (Amerika Serikat).
sleeping.references: Yayasan Tidur Nasional, Amerika Serikat https://sleepshow.org/how-much-sleep/

uploadResult.title: Unggah Hasil
uploadResult.info: Untuk hasil dengan banyak halaman, pilih Tambah Halaman untuk menambah lebih halaman.
uploadResult.privacy:
Privasi Anda adalah penting bagi kami. Anda memegang kendali atas informasi kesehatan Anda. BioMark tidak akan memberikan informasi Anda kepada pihak ketiga tanpa izin dari Anda.

BioMark hanya mendukung pengunggahan hasil lab untuk saat ini. Kami memiliki hak untuk menghapus dokumen yang tidak berkaitan dengan hasil lab.

fail.title: Gagal Mengunggah

errors.outOfBoundariesLbs: Silakan masukkan berat yang valid antara 0 - 440 lbs

confirm.title: Apakah Anda yakin?

common.noMore: Tidak ada lagi catatan untuk ditampilkan
common.noMoreInsights: Tidak ada lagi wawasan untuk ditampilkan
common.offlineNotification: Perangkat Anda saat ini bekerja di luar jaringan

prominentDisclosure.title: Disclosure
prominentDisclosure.healthApp: Our app will track the physical activities to track your health, monitoring your body weight, blood pressure, heart rate, workout intensity, sleep, stress levels
prominentDisclosure.storage: Our app will require access to storage for uploading the profile picture, lab results, medical reports
prominentDisclosure.camera: Our app will use camera to upload kyc documents, perform kyc using facial recognition, scan QR code for lab reports, medicines prescription to show to doctor
prominentDisclosure.wifi: Our app will access Wifi to see if you have wifi connectivity for tracking your health and fitness
prominentDisclosure.gps: Our app will collect GPS location of your device for booking appointment with health care professionals and identifying clinics and hospitals nearby, to show the nearby locations of clinics and hospitals where a patient can go.
